text: Oh what I've described in my speech as I
spoken about brexit is actually our
ambition as Britain our ambition for a
global Britain our ambition for a
Britain that not only has a good free
trade agreement with the European Union
but a Britain that is also trading
around the rest of the world and we've
seen a number of countries who want to
do trade agreements with us only today
the Australians have confirmed their
commitment for a trade deal with the
United Kingdom so I'm not to be
ambitious for the UK and am ambitious
for the UK and what we can achieve
trading with the EU but also trading
around the world a truly global Britain
why what if the banks said to you about
why they are moving jobs I've had a very
good positive discussion with banks
about the benefits of the City of London
about what it is that has brought them
to the city of London and how we can
continue to build on that for the future
and there are huge benefits for
investment in the UK we have a
fundamentally very strong economy we
have a service sector that is very
important to us but is valued around the
world
I believe that truly global Britain can
bring jobs and prosperity to the UK
across the board including in financial
services
I just wondering worrying wondering if
you agree with the Prime Minister of
Malta Christine Lagarde the head of the
International Monetary Fund European
commissioners who all say whatever deal
Britain manages to get with the European
Union it will be poorer economically
than what we have in the moment I think
it is in the interests not just of the
UK but also of the European Union of the
27 countries who will remain in the
European Union to have a good trade
agreement with the UK which allows that
benefits for UK businesses to be trading
with and operating within the single
European market but also for businesses
from those 27 countries to be operating
within the United Kingdom I believe that
as I say that's for both our benefits
and I in the trade agreement that we
negotiate I believe we'll be able to do
that it will be different we won't be
members of the European Union any longer
we will be outside the European Union
but I believe that we I want to build a
strong strategic partnership with the EU
because we're not leaving Europe we want
to continue to cooperate on security and
defence and to get that good Trade
Agreement
that is in all our interests
